title: Mask00
author: Mask00
content: [[ Multi userÂ & WalletÂ  Connected Â  ]][[ ThisÂ  3 Bitcointalk Account &Â  Wallet ConnectedÂ  ]]Siam20Profile link : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3436631Nila500Profile link : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2885338FikrildProfile Link : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3412638[[ Both account transfer and Received bnb feesÂ  ]]Proof 1: [[ Siam20 & Nila500Â  ]] bnb transfer Transaction : https://bscscan.com/tx/0x8196040184fe3f1cd212cd2c9cec8904ce85a53279faa63f414f96461954a66dProof 2: [[ Siam20 & Fikrild ]]Â  bnb transfer Transaction : https://bscscan.com/tx/0x9e2feb93abc3512f2ceff5d4d4122016e45fe7f9684c819a016483b4a84c4a83Main Wallet to other wallet transfer bnb feesðŸ‘‡1Â wallet: 0x56ddd48dccbffa4c191239addbd63e6a6ae9859fÂ Â  ðŸ‘‡ðŸ‘‡ðŸ‘‡2Â  wallet: 0x67ce6b29d2b18c4be7c31e28288ba3d9ec033d113 wallet : 0xc8e9ad7295ac03aa50614bc3c20ae51a77bf8a61I am new I Don't Know How ToÂ  Report connected address and multi users information But I am TryI hope @PedroBrainbossBMÂ  @julerz12 and All DT Members Review and Give Red This All Account

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: Mask00 on June 16, 2022, 09:17:29 AMAll DT Members Review and Give Red This All AccountWhy? See:Quote from: LoyceV on May 24, 2022, 07:54:24 AMI've said before that I think tagging Newbies for "bounty abuse" is futile. Accounts with high Activity and 0 Merit have nothing to lose, because they can easily create new accounts. Worse: it makes negative feedback very common instead of reserved for scammers, which leads to more and more people (including bounty/campaign managers) ignoring the warning. So I don't think tagging them makes the forum better.If you think someone deserves negative feedback: do it! See LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust system. There's no need to wait for DT-members to do the dirty work.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on June 16, 2022, 09:26:06 AMThere's no need to wait for DT-members to do the dirty work.The thing is, proof of transaction isn't enough to say they're alts, they can make an excuses if those accounts is his friend or made a deal of buy a digital goods etc. Moreover the @OP made this report without a proof of they're cheating in the same campaign. He's just think if there's any connection whether it's a transaction or somewhat are considered a worthy negative tag, but the truth is anyone can have multiple accounts as long as they're not doing a bad thing.@OP it's better if you provide strong proof to consider those accounts were controlled by a same person, you can search his address and social media accounts, if you search those accounts using same address or social media accounts, then post it here. Also bring a proof of those accounts were cheated in the same campaign, if those 2 requirements you failed to met, you can't expect a negative tag from DT members.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Sending to an address shouldn't be a legit proof other than the user used same address on different accounts on this forum to apply for a campaign or bounty in my opinion.Quote from: LoyceV on June 16, 2022, 09:26:06 AMQuote from: Mask00 on June 16, 2022, 09:17:29 AMAll DT Members Review and Give Red This All AccountWhy? See:Quote from: LoyceV on May 24, 2022, 07:54:24 AMI've said before that I think tagging Newbies for "bounty abuse" is futile. Accounts with high Activity and 0 Merit have nothing to lose, because they can easily create new accounts. Worse: it makes negative feedback very common instead of reserved for scammers, which leads to more and more people (including bounty/campaign managers) ignoring the warning. So I don't think tagging them makes the forum better.The red tag I have noticed before about this is when the person joined the same campaign, if OP have enough prove and most especially if the alts joined the same campaign, I see no reason the bounty hunter do not worth red tag. Even if the bounty manager knows about that, he can also reward the alts with red tag, provided if not to join the same campaign is among the rules stated. But obviously, anything related to scam and trust is what trust system should be used for while DT members are obviously misusing trust system.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: I read through the your accusations, but what you dropped there is a profile link of bitcointalk of the user. Filing a petition for someone, you should have gathered the vital information or documents of the user by rendering exactly the wallet that is been linked together. With that someone will know what to state towards the petition. According to what tender here, their no way you can say that account is been linked without a proper evidence of the account

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Did you know that having multiple accounts is allowed according to the official forum rules?Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM18. Having multiple accounts and account sales are allowed, but account sales are discouraged.So far, you haven't shown us what rule the accounts broke that makes you think the accounts deserve to be tagged by DT members
